intro: Oubanguia, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and used in traditional medicine. The plants typically have woody stems and produce small, clustered flowers in various colors. Oubanguia species are often found in dry, arid regions and are adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Their unique botanical features make them valuable in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
